general_requirements.statewide_program_name: Building and electrical permits required. Residential builder specialty registration with electrical classification required. Roof-mounted requires roofing classification. Systems limited to 20 kW AC per SC Code 58-39-20.

interconnection.net_metering_details: Net metering available with Duke Energy Carolinas and Dominion Energy SC. 2% cap on net metering participation.

special_considerations.hoa_restrictions: SC Code 27-1-60 limits HOA restrictions on solar. Cannot increase cost >$1,000.
special_considerations.historic_districts: Charleston historic district has strict additional requirements.
special_considerations.wind_load_requirements: Coastal areas have hurricane wind requirements. Design wind speeds 100-150 mph on coast.

licensing.license_type: Residential builder specialty registration with electrical classification. Roof-mounted also needs roofing classification.

notes: Growing solar market. Systems limited to 20 kW AC for residential net metering. Greenville County requires sealed structural review. Charleston requires certified engineer plans for historic areas.

jurisdictions.name: Charleston
jurisdictions.fire_code_requirements: Coastal wind load requirements. Hurricane zone standards.
special_requirements: Certified engineer plans for historic areas
jurisdictions.notes: Historic district has strict requirements. Permit $300-$500. Residential systems limited to 20 kW AC per SC law.

jurisdictions.name: Columbia
jurisdictions.notes: Standard SC permitting. 20 kW AC residential limit.

jurisdictions.name: Greenville
special_requirements: Sealed structural review with plan view required
jurisdictions.notes: Greenville County requires sealed/signed structural review with plan view of panel system. 20 kW AC limit.
